programme.title: Multitudes: The Power of Numbers (1)
programme.desc: Learning how life multiplies and comes together to create some of the most beautiful and overwhelming natural spectacles on Earth; looking inside puddles, oceans, wetlands, and other ecosystems to understand why wild creatures congregate in crowds.

programme.title: Wild Fighters (4)
programme.desc: The Struggle for Love. The love rivalry shakes every fiber of the body as hormones invade the blood, and some of the most overwhelming spectacles on the planet are produced; the language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most diverse behaviors.

programme.title: Big Animal Surgery (1)
programme.desc: Lion. In a South African sanctuary, Liz meets a nine-year-old lion called Ricci whose teeth are in such rough shape he can't eat; specially trained vets use unique tools and slightly more anaesthetic than estimated on the wakeful patient.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries (1)
programme.desc: Refugees of Laikipia. An endangered species of hartebeest is moved to Ol Pejeta so its land can be resettled by refugees.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries (2)
programme.desc: White Rhinos of Enasoit. Two white rhinos are moved to Ol Pejeta from a nearby ranch after it's discovered that poachers had been watching the animals.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa (2)
programme.desc: The Okavango: Lifeblood of the Kalahari. The Okavango Delta is home to a wide variety of African wildlife.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa (3)
programme.sub-title: Urban penguins. Penguins live on a tiny, urban cape in South Africa.
programme.desc: Urban penguins. Penguins live on a tiny, urban cape in South Africa.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa (4)
programme.desc: Precious Waters. During the dry season, the quest for water governs the lives of the animals in South Africa.

programme.title: Multitudes: The Power of Numbers (1)
programme.desc: Learning how life multiplies and comes together to create some of the most beautiful and overwhelming natural spectacles on Earth; looking inside puddles, oceans, wetlands, and other ecosystems to understand why wild creatures congregate in crowds.

programme.title: Wild Fighters (4)
programme.desc: The Struggle for Love. The love rivalry shakes every fiber of the body as hormones invade the blood, and some of the most overwhelming spectacles on the planet are produced; the language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most diverse behaviors.

programme.title: Big Animal Surgery (1)
programme.desc: Lion. In a South African sanctuary, Liz meets a nine-year-old lion called Ricci whose teeth are in such rough shape he can't eat; specially trained vets use unique tools and slightly more anaesthetic than estimated on the wakeful patient.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild (4)
programme.desc: Chico the Baby Capuchin. Enter Brazil's Serra da Capivara at the beginning of the dry season as a troop of capuchin monkeys welcomes its newest member; explore the forest alongside the curious baby, who faces threats from predators, food shortages, and even the wild climate.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (1)
programme.desc: Madagascar. Madagascar is home to strange animals not found anywhere else on Earth; when these animals fight for supremacy, their battles are just as strange, from weird neck-wrestling weevils to ring tailed lemur moms that go into battle with baby on board.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (2)
programme.desc: Australia. Australia is home to an eclectic array of creatures, and the ways to succeed as an alpha are just as diverse; the beach turns into a dueling ground and the outback becomes a boxing ring, as animals face off with their own kind.

programme.title: Secrets of the Enchanted Forests (1)
programme.sub-title: Tropical
programme.desc: Tropical

programme.title: Ireland's Wild Islands (2)
programme.desc: Edge of the Abyss. Eoin visits a wondrous native woodland on Clare Island and as he sails his Galway Hooker through Connemara's turquoise waters he finds deserted islands home to skylarks and on the Aran Islands, Ireland's only native reptile.

programme.title: Ireland's Wild Islands (3)
programme.desc: Echoes of the Past. Eoin is back in his Galway Hooker and sailing to the islands off County Kerry before heading south into his home waters off Cork and the end of his journey at Fastnet Rock.

programme.title: Kalahari: Land of Secret Alliances (1)
programme.desc: Into the Heat. The unlikely collaborators working to ensure mutual survival in the Kalahari Basin; an elephant clan's symbiotic link to fruiting anaboom trees, a meerkat's alliance with a feisty drongo bird, and more flora-and-fauna odd couples.

programme.title: Stormborn (2)
programme.desc: Return of the Light. Experience the North Atlantic's intense, brief summer with its animal residents; follow Arctic fox cubs learning to hunt for survival, an otter pup going solo for the first time, a mate-seeking puffin, and tiny reindeer taking their first steps.

programme.title: Stormborn (3)
programme.desc: Children of the Storm. Welcoming autumn to the North Atlantic, when its animals struggle to prepare for winter; tracing the grey seals' mating frenzy and witnessing the horrific price one seal pup must pay; reindeer undertake a perilous swim along their migration path.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife IV (12)
programme.sub-title: The Swan's Song. Spring patients are ready to return to the wild.
programme.desc: The Swan's Song. Spring patients are ready to return to the wild.

programme.title: World's Most Scenic River Journeys II (9)
programme.desc: The Neretva. Rumoured to be the cleanest river in Europe, few dispute it's the coldest; cascading down from the Dinaric Alps in Serbia, it soon crosses the border into Bosnia Herzegovina, where marine biologist and fisherman Sanel Riđanović casts for salmon.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife V (3)
programme.desc: A Very Precious Thing. Two tiny orphans struggle to survive; Hope takes a second swing at a release gone wrong.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons (5)
programme.desc: Springbok & Impala: Life in the Herd. Africa's charismatic megafauna receive a lot of attention, but the antelope have rich stories filled with daily struggles of survival; two antelope species, springbok and impala, outnumber all the others and play critical roles in the circle of life.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons (6)
programme.desc: The Hamadryas of Awash. Ethiopia is a land of extremes, home to mountainous highlands, vast river valleys, and parched deserts; for each of these disparate environments, a fascinating primate species has evolved traits and behaviors that allow its members to thrive.

programme.sub-title: Savannah Life. Creatures on the Savannah.

programme.title: Baby Chimp Rescue (2)
programme.desc: Breaking Point. At Liberia's only home for rescued chimpanzees, there are more new arrivals; Jimmy and Jenny Desmond and their team now have 28 chimps to look after, including an 8-week-old baby called Gaia.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains (3)
programme.desc: Praying for Rain. Anastasia's herd splits to protect two precious elephant calves; Kuleta retakes territory for her remaining cheetah cubs; Phoenix searches for a new mate; the skies open up and rain begins to heal the parched land.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild II (4)
programme.desc: Indonesia: The Secret Life of Manta Rays. Raja Ampat in the Indonesian archipelago is home to diverse marine life, including manta rays.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild II (5)
programme.desc: Indonesia: Amazon of the Seas. The Indonesian archipelago lies has the highest number of coral and fish species on earth.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife V (2)
programme.desc: Just Another Day. A rare owl appears ready for release but everyone wonders if it will fly.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas V (6)
programme.sub-title: Constellations. Historical and modern examinations of constellations.
programme.desc: Constellations. Historical and modern examinations of constellations.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas V (5)
programme.desc: Dark Energy. Studies are currently under way looking for evidence of dark energy in the movement of galaxies.

programme.title: World's Most Scenic River Journeys II (5)
programme.desc: River Suir. Discover the stories of six epic river journeys via the fascinating characters who live and work on and around the water.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild III (2)
programme.desc: Wild Coast of South Africa. The Wild Coast of South Africa, stretching 170 miles from East London to the KwaZulu-Natal border, is comprised of rivers that empty into the sea and indigenous forest.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas III (6)
programme.desc: Landing on Mars. The vast majority of information being gathered about Mars is by orbiters chronicling everything they can.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas IV (1)
programme.desc: The Milky Way. Exploring the Milky Way from the mythology of ancient sky watchers to how scientists are mapping it from the inside out.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild (6)
programme.desc: Bad Reputations. Some people are fighting to save the endangered massasauga rattlesnake, which was vilified for years.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild (7)
programme.sub-title: Endangered Species. The peregrine falcon population has been rising in numbers.
programme.desc: Endangered Species. The peregrine falcon population has been rising in numbers.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife IV (11)
programme.desc: Power & Primates. Hope discovers a horrifying problem in Costa Rica where man and monkey cross paths.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (1)
programme.desc: Chasing Freedom. Amanda races to save an elephant calf tangled in a poacher's wire snare; Alma tries to get a baby baboon nicknamed Doodle Bob to bond with a foster baboon mother.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (2)
programme.desc: Monkey Madness. Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years; the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical; a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (3)
programme.desc: The Great Escape. The team prepares to release two servals and a giant eagle owl, but the plan goes awry when a serval escapes into the dangerous city of Lilongwe; finding a foster mom for an orphaned vervet.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (4)
programme.desc: Big Buck Chase. Amanda goes on an adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare; the center's resident hyena is treated for fly-bitten ears; Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (5)
programme.desc: Creatures Great and Small. The wildlife rescue team attempt to collar an elephant, save a vervet monkey's leg, and help a baboon fend for herself.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (6)
programme.desc: Catch Me if You Can. Amanda and Mandy try everything at their disposal to help a snared hyena; the team's plan to release a troop of 13 monkeys is halted by last-minute surgery and some crafty escapees.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue (1)
programme.desc: Chasing Freedom. Amanda races to save an elephant calf tangled in a poacher's wire snare; Alma tries to get a baby baboon nicknamed Doodle Bob to bond with a foster baboon mother.

programme.title: Wild Fighters (3)
programme.desc: The Fight for Food. The most elemental and pure survival is based on eating; if an animal is not healthy, strong, and agile, they cannot compete to mate, defend their family from any threat, nor will they be able to achieve good status in their clan.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains (3)
programme.desc: Praying for Rain. Anastasia's herd splits to protect two precious elephant calves; Kuleta retakes territory for her remaining cheetah cubs; Phoenix searches for a new mate; the skies open up and rain begins to heal the parched land.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (11)
programme.desc: Loners. A glacial stroll alongside a Galápagos tortoise; dancing with venomous European adders; a battle between Lacerta lizards; leopard seals' stealth attacks.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas II (12)
programme.desc: Chatty/Communicative. Chatty capuchin monkeys; Eurasian river otters' chilling screams; fruit bats' loud complaints; orcas' human-scale speech systems.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Electric Turtles. The turtles are struck by lightning during a storm, turning them into positively charged projectiles zapping everything they touch and setting off all the appliances in the house. Mike gets locked outside by the raccoons who were freezing their little butts off in their lair. By the time Mike gets back inside all hell has broken loose, but Mike might have figured out how he can get rid of the raccoons and de-electrify the turtles at the same time.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Rescuing Roxanne. Playing with Louise and her doll gives Mike an idea. He decides to stage a rescue mission with the doll from the roof of the Mikkelson's house so he can be a hero and impress Iris. But as he prepares to show Iris that he's a real-life superhero, the racoons arrive and ruin his plans. Mercury falls in love with the doll the minute he lays eyes on it while Freddy sets his sights on her sparkly tiara. Now Mike has a real rescue on his hands, all under Iris's watchful gaze. The stakes couldn't be higher!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: A Sick Trick. The racoons watch Mike enviously as he makes himself comfortable in his living room. If only they could get a piece of that sweet action. Then Freddy has an idea. He crashes into the bay window and pretends to be injured, forcing the Mikkelsens to take him in. Mike sees through the ruse immediately, but if he's going to unmask the scheming raccoon he's going to have to defeat the imposter without getting himself in trouble for fighting the poor "injured" Freddy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Missing Teddy. Whilst browsing the supermarket for lovely grub, Mr. Bean’s life-long pal, Teddy, is kidnapped. Bean tracks down the nasty men responsible and finds that Teddy is not their only captive. Mr. Bean rescues a hundred teddy bears once their ears are put through an industrial sewing machine.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: No Parking. Mr Bean drives his favourite Teddy to the cinema to see his favourite movie - 'Titanic'. Now he simply has to park the car. But when you're Mr Bean, nothing's simple. His ingenious efforts to find a parking space are persistently foiled. And the clock is ticking....

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Artful Bean. There’s easy money to be had in the art world and Mr. Bean is set on getting some of it. Once equipped with the right tools, he ventures into the countryside with a blank canvas in search of inspiration – and comes home with a painting full of life. Literally.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Fly. When Mr. Bean finds a fly in his room, it's war. He needs weapons. Fly spray? A rolled-up magazine? These are only the start. In desperation, he enlists a mouldy doughnut, an encyclopaedia, an upside-down dustbin and a club-hammer. Finally, Bean becomes the first man in history to wage war on a fly... with a fridge.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Moley is a lively animated comedy series for children and families of all ages. It follows the underground adventures of a charmingly optimistic young mole, Moley. As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Moon Rock. When Slippy, Madhu and Ella head out to see a SuperNova, they arrive too late because of Slippy's endless preparations. The gang quickly decide to go zip-lining on Ganymede instead.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Trip in the Moon. Ella, Tilly, Slippy and Madhu are playing a game on the moon when it starts to rumble. The ground cracks open and they fall into what they discover is a large network of tunnels underground.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V
programme.sub-title: Dry Hard. A stranger with a diving rod promises to find water for the farm.
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V
programme.sub-title: Camelot Cat. Tom and Jerry save King Arthur's kingdom from and evil sorcerer, Morgan.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Toothache. Bean’s sweet tooth leads him to despair when he bites off a bit more than he can chew. He is tormented by the toothache from Hell - and embarks on a hilarious mission to pull out this menace. Bean’s DIY attempts fail to succeed, and he is left with no other choice but to visit the dreaded dentist. But can Bean brave the Dentist’s chair? Or will the dentist despair when faced with Bean’s antics?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Haircut. After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper! The photographer arrives with the grateful lady cat owner, the scene is set, smiles all round…but then disaster strikes when Bean is continually upstaged by… his hair.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Neighbourly Bean. As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Nurse! Envious of all the attention his landlady is receiving because of a broken leg, Mr. Bean decides to 'break' his leg too. When he ends up in hospital under the care of the Matron from Hell he discovers there are some kinds of attention even he doesn't enjoy.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Robot Without a Cause. When Glitch's compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Super Puff Planet. Slippy’s cousin Gem wants time apart from her twin brother I.Lo but he doesn’t want to hear it. When no one wants to investigate the super puff planet they discovered, Gem races off on her own, despite the high temperatures and strong winds.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Frenemies. When Rick and Ginger argue on their anniversary, Cupid decides to get involved. However, he gets a head injury in a chase between Tom and Jerry and forgets who he is. Now it's on Tom and Jerry to remind Cupid of his identity and help Ginger and Rick stop fighting.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: You Are What You Eat. Rick and Ginger wake up late and, in their hurry, they accidentally put dog food in Tom's bowl and cat food in Spike's. This causes Spike to behave like a cat and Tom to act like a dog. Although they're confused at first, they soon eat other types of food and discover how it makes them act.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Not My Tyke. Spike orders Tom and Jerry to watch Tyke while he's away, but instead Tom takes the opportunity to chase Jerry in the backyard. Suddenly, Tyke is nowhere to be seen and the front gate is wide open! Tom and Jerry must find the pup in time or face Spike's beating.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Everyone Into the Pool. When Tom and Jerry go to a pool party at Toodles's place, Tom shows off in the pool with ridiculous stunts. Butch and Meathead arrive, adding more rivalry to the party. Soon, Toodles suggests they play a game of water polo, which reaches a fever pitch before long.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: A Head For Science. On the edge of the village of Catsylvania, Tom is carried off to Dr. Frankenstein's castle lab. Several lightning bolts later, a monster comes to life: a nine-foot-tall hulk with Tom's relatively tiny head sewn on. Frankenstein orders the monster to go terrorize the village, but it has problems focusing after Tom's head sees Jerry in the lab.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Cat Cop. Ginger brings home an aerosol can of Rat Cop, rat and mouse repellent, to help Tom do his job. And it's not your typical rodent repellent! When the spray makes a human-shaped cop appear, it yells at Jerry and starts pursuit, along with Tom.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Super Puff Planet. Slippy’s cousin Gem wants time apart from her twin brother I.Lo but he doesn’t want to hear it. When no one wants to investigate the super puff planet they discovered, Gem races off on her own, despite the high temperatures and strong winds.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Cat-Sitting. After a head-on collision with the milkman, Mr. Bean’s landlady is rushed to hospital, leaving him to look after her odious one-eyed cat Scrapper. Fur isn’t the only thing that flies and in the end it’s Bean that needs looking after.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Bottle. Mr. Bean is delighted with his new ‘ship in a bottle’ until it mistakenly ends up on a milkman’s float. He frantically pursues his prize possession, only to see it disappear into a milk bottling plant at the local dairy. Getting it back promises to be a mission of the impossible.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Goldfish. With his teddy bear at the dry cleaners, Mr. Bean finds himself feeling lonely. Fortunately, a new playmate appears in the shape of a goldfish from the garden pond. Bean has a great time with his new best friend until, at the seaside, he discovers that some fish are gigantic, have large pointed teeth and fins on their backs.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Inventor. When Mr. Wicket gets a new lodger who is an Inventor, and a big nuisance, Bean discovers that he has to become ‘inventive’ himself. But, when your enemy is clever and sneaky, you have to be even cleverer and sneakier. Bean has never lost ‘a cleverness competition’, but maybe there is a first time for everything!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Wired. Alice decides to accompany Lewis on his trip to deliver vitamins to the Rainbow. It’s a pretty risky operation, involving climbing a very long wire, but Lewis is fearless thanks to his “balance button.” However, when he drops the button halfway, it’s panic all round! In the end, thanks to Alice, Lewis realizes that in order to accomplish his mission, he doesn’t need to recover his “balance button” after all - he merely needs to restore his self-confidence!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Lost Crown. After skidding out of control, the Queen loses her crown a little too long for comfort: as per the official rules, this deprives her de facto of her royal powers. At least now the tables can be turned: she can step into the shoes of her subjects, for once, and find out what it’s like to be a commoner. Or at least that’s what Alice is planning: unbeknownst to Lewis, she has hidden the precious crown on purpose: this little life lesson will do the Queen the world of good!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis
programme.desc: Six-year-old Alice has a magical key that leads her to Wonderland. In this “other realm”, she’s met an endearing rabbit, Lewis, and the two have become fast friends – best friends to be exact! Alice loves going to Wonderland and teaming up with Lewis and her other friends, even if it means contending with the whimsical, hot-headed Queen. Each episode entails a visit to Wonderland, where Alice experiences a wacky adventure with Lewis, confronting the crazy, eccentric rules and conventions that reign supreme in this parallel Kingdom. Alice’s adventures always begin in the “real world” where she is faced with a particular situation. Her far-fetched experiences in Wonderland lead her to a positive outcome or gain insight which helps her to resolve this dilemma and thus, at the end of each episode, she returns happily to the real world.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike Flu. Poor Mike is bedridden. He's been struck down by a nasty cold so Iris and the turtles are forced take care of his every need, including trying to repel the raccoons from the house. Fighting raccoons isn't their specialty and Iris and the turtles quickly end up locked in the garage. Mike is forced to intervene but he's so sick and weak that he's a pushover. How can he overcome the raccoons this time? Mike's problem could be the very solution he needs to defeat the tenacious raccoons.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.sub-title: Music Song. Join us in class to learn our Do, Re, Mi’s. Let’s sing along!
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series III
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In the wild. Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Moley is a lively animated comedy series for children and families of all ages. It follows the underground adventures of a charmingly optimistic young mole, Moley. As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: 'Oumuamua Memories. Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Waterworld. Slippy promised his uncle to water his plants while he is away. When he finally heads to the greenhouse, he discovers that the watering system he built is broken. The plants are not doing well.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V
programme.sub-title: Piňata Yadda Yadda. Tom has trouble keeping track of a pinata full of stolen loot.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Young Bean. When did Mr. Bean first meet his teddy bear? Did he really learn to drive his mini at the age of ten? Could he possibly have known his battle-axe of a landlady when she was a sweet and blushing bride? Bean takes us on a journey into the past, answering these questions and giving us an inkling as to what made him the man he is today.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In the pink. Mr. Bean finds himself lumbered with an unwanted pet in the form of a four-legged ball of pink fur with piggy eyes and a penchant for earthworms. Encyclopedias leave him none the wiser as to the identity of the pesky creature but Bean can’t bring himself to just abandon it. The puzzle is eventually solved after a picnic in the park and a raid on the local pet shop.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Dinner for two. Mr. Bean forgets the golden rule: never fall asleep in the bath when you've got a chicken in the oven. So what romantic meal can he quickly rustle-up for his luckless girlfriend, Irma Gobb? The cheese from the mousetrap? The flower from the vase? A meal is eventually provided by an uninvited guest.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Ball. The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road. Paralysed with vertigo sixty feet up on a windowsill, he is eventually brought to earth by the helpful intervention of a neighbour’s pet gerbil.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Moley is a lively animated comedy series for children and families of all ages. It follows the underground adventures of a charmingly optimistic young mole, Moley. As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

programme.title: Moley

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Moon Rock. When Slippy, Madhu and Ella head out to see a SuperNova, they arrive too late because of Slippy's endless preparations. The gang quickly decide to go zip-lining on Ganymede instead.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Trip in the Moon. Ella, Tilly, Slippy and Madhu are playing a game on the moon when it starts to rumble. The ground cracks open and they fall into what they discover is a large network of tunnels underground.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Eggstra Credit. Tom and Jerry awake to the smell of eggs being cooked in the kitchen – Ginger and Rick are making breakfast courtesy of their neighbor's fresh eggs. Ginger and Rick talk about how their new neighbor has a suburban henhouse and is raising their own produce. Tom and Jerry team up to target the henhouse for a heist, but it's easier said than done.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Costume Party Smarty. As Rick and Ginger prepare for a costume party, Tom tries to score some snacks. Jerry and Tuffy are out to do the same. Spike and Tom are initially confused by the guests' costumes. Determined to get their paws on as much party food as they can, however, they contrive their own costumes to crash the party. Will they get away with it?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Battle of the Butlers. Old Snelgrove, the senior butler, is retiring. There is an open backyard Olympics on the estate to see who will replace him. When the contestants in the field are narrowed down to Butch and Tom, what will the final outcome be?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Kid Stuff. A little baby goat butts his head through a distant wall of the estate and starts nibbling the grass. At first, he helps Tom with the yardwork but then causes chaos throughout the manor. Tom and Jerry are left to deal with the kid.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Stolen Heart. When a gorgeous feline walks into the Cat and Mouse Detective Agency, Tom is immediately smitten. But someone has already stolen her heart—a heart-shaped cake made for a gangster and his fiancée on their upcoming engagement. He asked for the expensive engagement ring to be baked into the batter as a Valentine's Day surprise, but the cake and the jewelry were stolen from the bakery window.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: The Last Laugh. Red Herring complains to Tom and Jerry that he keeps hearing laughter everywhere he goes. Tom and Jerry bodyguard Red to prevent him from doing anything that might provoke laughter, but Red's goof-ups and fails soon have even them convulsed. Gradually, it gets loud enough that Tom and Jerry can hear it too. Will they find the true source of the laughter?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: The Invisible Cat. On another scary night in the castle, The Invisible Cat wants nothing more than to catch mice. After it picks up and carries Jerry and Tuffy, Tom is really confused (and spooked) to see the two mice "magically" float through the air! When Tom accidentally smacks The Invisible Cat in the face and knocks Jerry and Tuffy free of his hold, it sparks a slapstick fight between the two cats.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Moon Rock. When Slippy, Madhu and Ella head out to see a SuperNova, they arrive too late because of Slippy's endless preparations. The gang quickly decide to go zip-lining on Ganymede instead.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Nurse! Envious of all the attention his landlady is receiving because of a broken leg, Mr. Bean decides to 'break' his leg too. When he ends up in hospital under the care of the Matron from Hell he discovers there are some kinds of attention even he doesn't enjoy.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Dead Cat. Whilst trying to redecorate the hall, Bean is obstructed at every turn by his landlady’s vile one-eyed cat. Bean pops it in the dustbin to keep it out of the way for a while. Just his luck that it’s rubbish collection day.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Supertrolley. Nipping to the shops for a few provisions becomes a nightmare when a mile-long shopping list from his landlady and a clapped out trolley with a wonky wheel conspire to ruin his day. Subscribing to the theory that bigger is better, he constructs his own shopping trolley incorporating a petrol mower, pram wheels and an extra pair of hydraulic hands.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Magpie. When nursing an injured magpie in his room, Mr. Bean learns something the rest of us already know: magpies can’t help stealing anything that sparkles. When the police arrive to investigate the theft of his landlady’s jewellery, it’s not just Mr. Bean that needs to take flight.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Red Light, Green Light
programme.desc: Red Light, Green Light

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: A Joker for a Queen. Jojo, one of the King of Frostaland’s joker cards, looks on in awe as Queen skillfully guides her procession of cards with a snap of her fingers! When the King responds with his own parade, however, he lets his cards do whatever they please, leaving poor Jojo clueless. This prompts her to decide to leave Frostaland and head off to train in Wonderland, to be part of the Queen’s parade. Noticing how sad the King is to see his joker card go, Alice and Lewis do everything they can to persuade Jojo to return. But in so doing, they too find themselves enrolled alongside the Queen’s cards!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Double Teatime in Wonderland. Jealous of the King of Frostaland, who is celebrating Alice’s “non-birthday,” the Queen organizes a double-teatime at the castle and forces all her subjects to attend. Alice and Lewis try to enjoy both celebrations. But there’s no denying it: it’s way more chill at the King’s party than the Queen’s, where the poor guests are subjected to fear and intimidation! In fact, it’s so bad that before long, the Queen’s guests start defecting, migrating to the more fun venue in Frostaland. Alice and Lewis try to avoid a crisis by making sure the Queen doesn’t find out they’re having fun behind her back…

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Dodson's Predictions. In order to escape punishment, Dodson kids the Queen into believing he is able to read the future. Falling for his story, Queen names him “Great Fortune-Telling Dodo” and invites him to live in the castle. Dodson milks it, using his influence over the monarch to fulfill all his desires, even if it means relieving poor Lewis of his clockmaster duties! Luckily, Alice runs to her rabbit friend’s rescue. But how are they going to prove to the Queen that Dodson doesn’t actually have a single power and that he’s merely using her for his own benefit?!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The "Werewolf Cactus". Lewis gets a shock when he wakes up one morning and sees all his carrots have been gobbled up overnight! To get to the bottom of it, Alice and Lewis call on the Police Card. Our two heroes accuse Dodson right off the bat: he seems to be the perfect suspect! But then discover the true culprit: a cactus that transforms into a “werewolf cactus” when night falls! And Alice and Lewis are in for a big surprise when they find out who is behind this famished creature!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: In The Doghouse. Mike is forced to spend the day outside in his doghouse due to Grandma Mikkelsen's fur allergy. Mike makes the best of being exiled and plans to spruce the place up and invite Iris over for an outdoor picnic. But Mercury has been kicked out of his lair after a fight with his brother and decides to squat in the doghouse. Mike does everything he can to wake up the snoozing raccoon and get him out of his home. It looks like he's going to have to bring in the big guns if has any chance of evicting his unwanted guest before Iris shows up.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series III
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Moley is a lively animated comedy series for children and families of all ages. It follows the underground adventures of a charmingly optimistic young mole, Moley. As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Supergiant Search. Ella and her friends play a star-riddle game that is a tradition in Slippy’s family. In order to beat Slippy’s cousins, they need to find some super-giant stars!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Birthday Stars. It's Priya's birthday so the gang is looking for something special as a gift for her. Ella suggests a birthday star, which is a star that is the same light years away as your age.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V
programme.desc: A Kick in the Butler. A Tom and Jerry chase through Postlewaite Manor results in major injuries to Cates which places his defense of the Butler's Linen Gloves Boxing Title in jeopardy. But never fear, Tom will step into the ring and defend Cate's title.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show V

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Homeless. After a regrettable episode involving his landlady sleepwalking into his room, Mr. Bean suddenly finds himself out on his ear with nowhere to live. Near to tears, he yearns for the cosy familiarity of his old home. A scarecrow and a pair of false teeth come to his rescue.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Camping. An old photo album causes Bean to reminisce about his lovely summers at scout camp as a boy, and sets him planning a night under the stars with Teddy. Purchasing a tent becomes a tricky problem – but nothing will stop him having a good time, even if he has to get the garden shed over the roof of his house.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chocks Away. When his model aeroplane is blown out of the sky by that of a rival kid, Mr. Bean sets his sights on revenge. Next day, his newly constructed fighter plane, almost ready for take-off, sadly lacks a vital part – and the blinking model shop is shut! No matter. It’s chocks away with Teddy at the controls, fighting for airspace over London N10.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Royal Bean. When Mr. Bean breaks his favourite Royal mug he discovers there's only one place to buy a replacement: Buckingham Palace, home of the Queen of England. When one of Her Majesty's corgis runs off with his teddy, Bean gives chase through secret tunnels… and gets lost.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Things We Love. The bugs talk about what they love.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Moley

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: 'Oumuamua Memories. Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Waterworld. Slippy promised his uncle to water his plants while he is away. When he finally heads to the greenhouse, he discovers that the watering system he built is broken. The plants are not doing well.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Frown and Country. Jerry is feeling lonely and wishes he had a girlfriend. Spike explains spring fever to Tom and they leave him be. Jerry's mood improves when he gets a message from his brawny cousin Muscles, who has fixed him up with his girlfriend's friend for a double date.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Vocal Yokel. Little Quacker develops the ability to sing like Pavarotti. But when Tom plots to use this to win a prize on the "Pets With Talent" TV show, Little Quacker refuses and Jerry covers for him. As things continue to snowball, it's up to Tom to attempt saving the day.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Hamster Hoopla. After Ginger keeps an abandoned pet hamster unbeknown to Rick, Jerry takes its place after the hamster scurries off. However, Jerry soon gets displaced by baby hamsters that keep multiplying. Soon the situation is out of control.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Tuff Shooting. Under-Butler Tom helps the Lord of the Manor have a trouble-free afternoon hunting with his guests shooting skeet, and Tom's only job is to keep handing clay birds to the head butler. But Tom gets distracted when he sees Jerry and Tuffy eating the fabulous spread of food for the Lord's guests! Tom is so mad he abandons his duty and rushes Jerry and Tuffy, leading to an epic chase.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Anger Mismanagement. Inside the house, Tom and Jerry get into a full-on brawl. Steam comes out of their ears as they face off. Just then, Ginger and Rick walk in, grab both by the scruff of their necks, and says they have to learn to deal with their anger. Ginger shoves a copy of an anger management book at them. Spike and Tom both roll their eyes but agree to make an effort.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Vampire State. On the edge of the village of Catsylvania, a bat snatches up Tom by his tail. He is carried off to a castle in the mountains and emerges in a full Dracula cape and fangs. The real Dracula appears and demands a snack. Tom swoops down on a tiny mouse village, scaring the villagers and carrying off a few. An angry mob with torches and rakes call on Jerry Van Mouseling to go rescue their kin.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: It Ain't Over Until the Cat Lady Sings. When Kitty Caterwaul goes missing the night before the opening of her new musical, "Kitty Foiled," her agent begs Tom and Jerry to take on the case. The search leads the detectives backstage, where they encounter chaos and no shortage of people who could have had a motive. Will the clues lead them to a culprit much closer to home?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: 'Oumuamua Memories. Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Waterworld. Slippy promised his uncle to water his plants while he is away. When he finally heads to the greenhouse, he discovers that the watering system he built is broken. The plants are not doing well.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Ball. The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road. Paralysed with vertigo sixty feet up on a windowsill, he is eventually brought to earth by the helpful intervention of a neighbour’s pet gerbil.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Toothache. Bean’s sweet tooth leads him to despair when he bites off a bit more than he can chew. He is tormented by the toothache from Hell - and embarks on a hilarious mission to pull out this menace. Bean’s DIY attempts fail to succeed, and he is left with no other choice but to visit the dreaded dentist. But can Bean brave the Dentist’s chair? Or will the dentist despair when faced with Bean’s antics?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Haircut. After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper! The photographer arrives with the grateful lady cat owner, the scene is set, smiles all round…but then disaster strikes when Bean is continually upstaged by… his hair.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Neighbourly Bean. As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Hay, Now!
programme.desc: Hay, Now!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Snow Queen. Alice and Lewis make a "snow-woman" in the Queen’s likeness. But, miffed at not bearing a very strong resemblance to the original, she heads off to meet her model. Our two heroes are scared: their mockery is about to be discovered! But surprise surprise!: the Queen is anything but offended! In fact, she takes the snow-woman under her wing, even going so far as to appoint her her deputy! Unfortunately for Alice and Lewis, this icy substitute becomes just as moody as the Queen: now they’re going to have to do all they can to remind her who she truly is!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Blue Door Mystery. Queen is seething: her QueenMobile has broken down on the other side of Wonderland and she hasn’t found any blue doors to get her back home. So she commissions Alice and Lewis to draw up a map of all the blue doors in the Kingdom. The mission turns out to be more complicated than expected when our heroes realize the doors in question are VERY FIDGETY!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Trainee Book-Wizards. Before heading off on a trip to find new seeds, the Book-Wizard entrusts his garden to his new apprentices, Alice and Lewis. But it’s a pretty stressful experience: besides having to tend to the garden, they also have to answer the Twins when they come to ask for advice, and entertain the Queen when she decides to turn up unannounced, for teatime! And when Charlie gets whisked away by a bird-book, it’s panic-stations for the two apprentices. In fact, things get so out of hand that they have to call the Book-Wizard to the rescue!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Heel! What a disaster!: the Queen’s favorite booties have gone missing! And if Alice and Lewis don’t find them, they’re going to have to shine all fifty-thirteen other pairs of shoes in her majesty’s possession! Hot on the heels of the mischievous boots, our two heroes must use clever tactics to persuade them to get back to the Queen’s feet!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Hoverboard. Mike is impressed with Tom's hoverboard tricks and decides to try to master them to impress Iris. As soon as Tom steps out, Mike tries to get his hands on the board but the turtles have other ideas. In fact, everyone seems to want a turn on the hoverboard, including the raccoons. It's the perfect way for them to get their loot from the house to their den. Mike is going to have to step up if he wants to defeat the raccoons and get Tom's hoverboard back.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Hypnosis. Mike wakes up in the bathtub, huh? The house has been turned upside down and the other animals are being weird. They're acting like zombies and carrying food out of the house. Our pug discovers that the raccoons have hypnotised Fluffy, the turtles, and Iris, and are using them to transport the contents of the Mikkelsens fridge to their lair. Our hero will need to confront Iris to save her from the raccoon's dastardly scheme... and refill the Mikkelson's fridge!

However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.sub-title: Bat Surfin'. Surf-riding musical mayhem with Batman, Robin, and the Batwheels!
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.sub-title: Hide N' Seek. The crew plays Hide N’ Seek at headquarters and Tweety is the seeker.
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series III
programme.desc: Mr Bean returns for a third series of his animated adventures. Featuring in 26 brand new episodes. This series follows Mr Bean, his best friend Teddy and his long-suffering landlady Mrs Wicket as we witness more of the mishaps that surround Mr Bean's daily life. Mr Bean becomes obsessed with computer gaming, prevents Mrs. Wicket from selling her house, builds his own caravan, rescues a football from a haunted house and finds himself in many other hilarious escapades. All voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Moley is a lively animated comedy series for children and families of all ages. It follows the underground adventures of a charmingly optimistic young mole, Moley. As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Human Day. Human Day is Ella’s favourite day of the year and she invites Madhu to join her family for dinner. Madhu wants to make a good impression and wonders how to prepare.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Going Rogue. While checking out a rogue planet, Ella, Slippy and Madhu crash onto its surface. When the heat from underground causes the planet’s icy crust to burst open, they all tumble down into the darkness and become separated.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
